text.text_translated: Stereotypes are simple ideas about a group of people. These ideas are often not true. People from different countries can act in different ways. They can also expect different things. It is good to know about these differences. This can help us avoid problems when we talk. But we must be careful. Stereotypes can be very bad for building good business relationships. A person's country is only one part of who they are. Many other things influence a person. The area they come from is important. Their age and gender are important. Their company culture is important. Their own experiences in life are also important. So, it is good to know about cultural differences. But we should keep this knowledge in the back of our minds. We should not use it to judge people. We must not think all people from one country are the same. We need to see each person as an individual.
